intro: Navarretia macombii, commonly known as Macomb's navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and slender, branching stems. Navarretia macombii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal bluffs.
